did.abstract: Sheryl M. Szady is a University of Michigan alumna and employee who played an integral role in the evolution of women's athletics at the university. The collection includes meeting minutes, correspondence and other materials from her work with numerous university affiliated organizations including the Friends of the Michigan League, the Kinesiology Alumni Society, and Letterwinners M Club, as well as Interlochen Center for the Arts in Interlochen, Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The papers of Sheryl Szady (donor no. 7769) were received in multiple accessions in 2010.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Sheryl M. Szady papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Sheryl M. Szady received her B.S. in Physical Education (1974), M.S. (1975), and Ph.D. (1987) from the University of Michigan. Her Ph.D. dissertation was entitled, "The History of Intercollegiate Athletics for Women at the University of Michigan," and is available through the University of Michigan's Deep Blue digital repository. While attending Michigan as an undergraduate, Szady played field hockey, volleyball, and basketball. When she began playing, all women's sports at the University of Michigan were club sports. As co-president of the Michigan Sports Club Federation (MSCF), Szady worked with fellow students and faculty to establish a varsity intercollegiate athletic program for women. She sat on the Committee to Study Intercollegiate Athletics for women, sometimes referred to as the Burns Committee. The committee's reports led to the creation of six varsity women's sports for the 1973-1974 season. Additionally, Szady helped secure the 'block M' award for the University of Michigan's women athletes in 1975.

Szady worked for the University of Michigan throughout her career, retiring in 2012 from her position as Director, Research and Marketing Data in the Office of Development. During her tenure, she was active on the board of numerous organizations, including: M Women, Letterwinners M Club (M Club), Friends of the Michigan League, Kinesiology Alumni Society, and the Interlochen Center for the Arts.

Szady participated in Interlochen Center for the Arts' Interlochen Arts Camp (1971-1984), and was on the Interlochen Arts Academy faculty (1975-1982) teaching physical and health education. She is a member and past president of the Interlochen Alumni Organization and a former ex-officio member of ICA's Board of Trustees.

scopecontent.p: The Sheryl Szady papers include meeting minutes, correspondence and other materials from her work with numerous university affiliated organizations and Interlochen Center for the Arts. The papers date from 1984-2010, with the bulk of documentation from 1997-2007. The collection is divided into two subgroups: University of Michigan and Interlochen Center for the Arts.

scopecontent.p: The Sheryl Szady papers include meeting minutes, correspondence and other materials from her work with numerous university affiliated organizations and Interlochen Center for the Arts. The papers date from 1984-2010, with the bulk of documentation from 1997-2007. The collection is divided into two subgroups: University of Michigan and Interlochen Center for the Arts.

The Alumni Research Conferences, 1989-2000, series contains agendas, meeting and her presentation materials for two conferences, the AIR Institute Conference (1989-1990) and BSR Conference (1989-2000), arranged chronologically. These conferences focused on the collection and utilization of alumni research data.

The UM Alumni Census, 1986, contains the official alumni census report, including the census survey, findings, strategic planning and evaluation. The census was conducted to get updated information on alumni and gather data for use in enhancing fund solicitation during the Campaign for Michigan.

The Michigan League, 1995-2009, series is divided into three subseries: Friends of the Michigan League Board, 1995-2009; Board of Governors, 2002-2009; Miscellaneous, 2003-2009. The first subseries, arranged chronologically, primarily contains meeting agendas, minutes, and supplemental material; by-laws, fundraising materials; newsletters; and other miscellaneous records for the Friends of the Michigan League. The Board of Governors subseries, arranged chronologically, primarily contains meeting agendas, minutes, supplemental material, and the Member Manual for the Michigan League Board of Governors. The Miscellaneous subseries consists primarily of printed materials and records pertaining to the University Unions as a whole.

did.unittitle: Friends of the Michigan League Board 1995-2009
Friends of the Michigan League and Board of Governors joint meeting 2006-2007

scopecontent.p: The Kinesiology Alumni Society, 1994-2006, series, arranged chronologically, consists of meeting agendas, minutes, and supplemental material; correspondence; and miscellaneous materials.

The M Club, 2006-2010, series, arranged chronologically, includes meeting agendas, minutes and supplemental materials for the Letterwinners M Club board and business meetings; correspondence; publications and other materials pertaining to M Club.

did.unittitle: M Club and Alumni Association Conference Call 2009

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous UM Athletics, 1984-2009, series, arranged chronologically, consists of materials from various University of Michigan organizations, departments, and facilities related to athletics, including: The Central Campus Recreation Building, Paul Robeson Research Center (affiliated with the Department of Kinesiology), Recreational Sports, Sports Institute, UM Athletic Department, UM Corner Club (field hockey), Victors Club, and Victory Hoops Club (basketball).
The Interlochen Center for the Arts subgroup is divided into four series: General, Interlochen Alumni Organization, Board of Trustees, and Printed Materials.

The General, 1997-2007, series contains materials pertaining to Interlochen Center for the Arts programs which are not directly related to the Board of Trustees or the Interlochen Alumni Organization. This includes: 75th Anniversary materials, By-Laws, Commencement ceremony invitations and programs, fundraising, Interlochen Arts Camp, Interlochen Pathfinder School, Interlochen Public Radio, seventh ICA president Jeffrey Kimpton, Correspondence, Press and Press Releases, materials related to the 2003-2004 restructure, and miscellaneous other items.

The Interlochen Alumni Organization, 1991-2009, series consists of materials related to Alumni events, weekends, retreats, and reunions; IAO Board meeting agendas, supplemental materials, and minutes; member lists, projects, and By-Laws; and correspondence, including a debate on election procedure.

The Board of Trustees, 1991-2008, series consists of annual reports; meeting agendas, supplemental materials and minutes; member lists; correspondence; committees, including the Investment committee; the Institute for Education and the Arts; and ICA strategic plans.

did.unittitle: Institute for Education and the Arts 2002

scopecontent.p: The Printed Materials, 2000-2009, series consists of brochures, flyers, programs and miscellaneous other materials printed by ICA. This series is organized by the ICA program in the materials, including: Arts Festival, fundraising, Interlochen Arts Academy, Interlochen Arts Camp, the presidential newsletter Interlochen Briefing, Interlochen Center for the Arts, Interlochen College of Creative Arts, Interlochen Pathfinder School, reunion programs, miscellaneous invitations, miscellaneous programs, and miscellaneous other printed items.

did.unittitle: Interlochen Center for the Arts 2000-2008, undated

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Sheryl Szady has donated additional materials to the Bentley Historical Library that can be found in other collections. Researchers interested in Szady's other materials (most notably those pertaining to women's athletics and Interlochen Center for the Arts) should search for Sheryl Szady across all finding aids.

Researchers interested in women's athletics at the University of Michigan may want to consult the Bentley Library's exhibit, "A Sporting Chance: Women's Athletics at the University of Michigan" (http://bentley.umich.edu/exhibits/womensathletics/) as well as the following collections containing materials donated by Sheryl Szady:
M Women Publications
Michigan Women's Athletic Association of the University of Michigan records
Marie D. Hartwig papers

Researchers interested in materials related to the Interlochen Center for the Arts in Interlochen, MI should consult the Bentley Historical Library's following collection:
Interlochen Center for the Arts records
